title: Cornerstone
h1: Bringing hope to our community through Christ and His church
text: Scroll Bringing hope to our community through Christ and His church Welcome to CornerstoneThank you for visiting our website! Cornerstone Community Church is a diverse, contemporary, non-denominational Christian church located in the Kensington section of Philadelphia. Jesus Christ has changed our lives! We believe that he is the source of life, truth and hope. Because of his love for us, we reach out to love and serve our community. We would love to have you stop by and see what the Lord is doing here at Cornerstone! Sunday Morning ServiceSunday mornings at Cornerstone are both unique and familiar. If you have been a part a church service at other churches then you will recognize a time of worship followed by a sermon from the Word of God. What is unique about Cornerstone is the loving family you join as soon as you walk in the door. Please come check us out! Learn More about Sunday Mornings Kids' ClubIf you are a child between the ages of 5 and 12 then Kids' Club is the place for you! Every Tuesday Night (except the first Tuesday of each month) kids from the community gather at Cornerstone to enjoy fun games, great Bible stories, and some awesome snacks! Learn More about Kids' Club teen clubTeen Club offers something for everyone, from basketball to video games and everything in between, we love to have fun, enjoy delicious food, build new friendships, and discover how God’s Word applies to the current issues we face every day. Learn More About Teen Events Gather. Grow. Go. 1 Cor 13:13 the Bible declares: “And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love.” As followers of Jesus Christ we pursue faith, hope and love. Specifically at Cornerstone Community Church we gather in hope, grow in faith and go in love. As a church we often gather together. We are united in the hope of the Gospel (good news) of our Lord Jesus Christ. We share that hope with others both inside our church building and out in our community. When people receive the Gospel message and put their faith in Jesus’ death on the cross for our sins, we help them to grow in their faith. This takes place through our church services, Bible studies, fellowship and many Christ-centered friendships. However, we must never just remain within the walls of our church building. Our calling is to go in love to our community. We seek to serve our neighbors in many tangible ways. By loving and serving, we hope to show the life-changing love of Jesus Christ to others so they too can know the joy of a relationship with our Lord! Please join us at Cornerstone as we gather in hope, grow in faith and go in love! Cornerstone 2025 Highlights Learn more about the Gospel The Gospel for Kids

title: Our Purpose — Cornerstone
text: Our Purpose Our Purpose as a Church...Cornerstone Community Church is a church plant in the Kensington section of Philadelphia. We believe that we are called to be the hands and feet of Jesus Christ to the community. We strive to accomplish this by investing in the community through youth outreaches, adult Bible studies, Sunday morning services, and various other ministries. We are a non-denominational, Bible believing church. We hold to these core truths: Worship Our God: Our God is awesome, amazing...! We desire to bring glory and honor to Him in all that we do. We will faithfully worship our great God in our church and with our lives. Share Our Faith: Jesus Christ CAN change lives! We will invite our friends and neighbors to begin a relationship with God by trusting in the Lord Jesus Christ. We will boldly declare the Good News of His death and resurrection. Love Our Family: God works through His Church! We will establish aChristian community where all ages, races and cultures can fellowship together. Our church will be a place where people love, encourage and care for one another. Build Up Our Members: God wants us to grow in our faith. We will disciple believers to maturity in their relationship with Christ. We will faithfully teach God’s Word and apply it to our lives. Serve Our Community: We must put our faith into action! God wants us to show his love to our church family and our community. We will equip believers to use their gifts, abilities and resources to minister to others. We would love for you to join us on a Sunday morning or one of our many ministries throughout the week!

title: Our Story — Cornerstone
text: Our StoryThe History of Cornerstone In 1980 Bill Curry and some students from Philadelphia College of Bible started a Thursday night ministry (Teen Club) for teenagers at the Kensington Neighborhood House (3068 Frankford Avenue.) Many neighborhood teens attended, enjoyed the games and activities, and learned God’s Word. Teen Club still continues to serve young people on Thursday nights – over 40 years later!In 1987 a children’s ministry (Kids Club) was started by Bill and PCB students on Tuesdays for children ages 5-12. This program quickly grew and blessed many children. They loved the singing, games, Bible lessons and refreshments. Kids Club stills meets on Tuesday nights – over 35 years later! Thousands of children and teenagers have benefitted from Kids Club and Teen Club over the years.In 1988 Joe and Laurie Darrow moved into Kensington and began to serve the Kensington community. Joe became the director of this inner city ministry. Joe worked to obtain a new building for the ministry called the Hewitt Center at 3058 Frankford Avenue. This enabled the youth ministry to expand considerably. The Darrows have served in Kensington for 35 years!In 1994 Andy and Shannon Schultz moved into Kensington to serve this community. They had served with the Kids Club as volunteers and now they devoted their full-time energies to youth ministry. They have served full-time with our inner-city youth for almost 30 years!Also in 1994 we were given a church building to meet in. Allegheny Avenue Baptist Church was located at the corner of Frankford and Allegheny Avenues. The pastor of Allegheny Avenue Baptist Church had helped Bill Curry start the Teen Club in 1980. He was called to become a missionary in Nicaragua. Allegheny Avenue Baptist Church had its own rich history of ministry in the community since 1883.Having obtained a church building, Cornerstone Community Church was planted. Sunday services and Bible studies began. Pastor Joe Darrow directed our ministry and Pastor David Grainge did the preaching. Our youth ministries grew even more with this larger building.Extensive renovations were done over the next 10 years as the building had deteriorated significantly. God provided the funds and volunteers to do a dramatic rehab. We were excited to have a beautiful baptismal pool and our first baptisms. Our first wedding was Pastor Bill and Patsy Curry in 1995.Our ministry grew rapidly. In 1996 we started Family Night on the first Tuesday of each month. Family Night serves many families in our community and still continues to this day. In 1997 we organized our first Block Party as a creative way to bless and reach our community. Today the annual Block Party continues with well over 1000 participants.In 1998 we purchased a large lot next to the church and built an amazing playground and picnic grove. God gave us a wonderful place to play and fellowship!In 2002 we welcomed our first official members. In 2004 Bill Curry became the lead pastor at Cornerstone. Our church was rapidly growing and more people joined our staff. More new ministries were started.In 2006 we bought the house next to the church at 2058 E. Allegheny Avenue. The house is the center for our many adult Bible studies throughout the week. Eventually it also became the base for our food cupboard. About 100 families receive bags of food each week to help them get by.The Lord amazingly provided us with a new building in 2007 next to the Light House which we call the Miracle House. This house had been a drug and prostitution haven for many years. The city of Philadelphia sold us the house for $1. It is now base for our addictions recovery ministry.Over the last 40+ years God has touched so many lives. People of all ages have had their lives transformed through the power of the Gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ. Hurting people have been restored, the enslaved have found freedom, marriages and relationships have been restored, and broken families have been healed. Physical, emotional and spiritual needs have been met.We are amazed at all the Lord has done throughout the history of our ministry. There is so much more we could write of His great works. We give the Lord Jesus Christ all the glory for what He has accomplished!
